Reviews.Title: The screen is dismal.
Reviews.Author: Ivan Rivera
Reviews.Content: Pros: - It works fine for normal office tasks. - The keyboard is great for this price point. - The unit is fairly light though thicker than most.Con: - The screen badly needs improvement. Contrast and color balance are just behind the rest, even against other entry level laptops.- You're probably better off with the cheaper and better-speced Acer V5-561-9410.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: barbovacs
Reviews.Content: I have been using lenovo laptops at work for years (and IBM prior to that).  I have gotten very comfortable with the little red joystick, and also the location of the select buttons on the trackpad. So when I needed to get a laptop of my own, those were features that lead me to pick Lenovo ThinkPad.  I also appreciate the glare resistant screen.  I was pleased to see that I could get this computer, but sad it was not available locally and a bit apprehensive about ordering it online without first seeing it.  There are some slight differences in the selection keys, but that is Ok since the location is the same.  I am pleased with the computer and the availability of Windows 7 with upgrade discs for w8 provided, the i5 processor and 8G and DVD provided.  And the computer arrived within 2 days of placing the order...perfect for my needs. At 1 week, I am a satisfied customer.
